alert.note: Alert for Grafton; Merrimack; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 12:19AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Merrimack and Sullivan. In northern New Hampshire, Grafton. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1217 AM EDT, Local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area, including developing washouts in Sunapee from runoff of previous rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Henniker, New London, Grafton, Enfield, Canaan, Bradford, Newport, Warner, Grantham and Goshen.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
